required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Home Self-Testing for HIV to Increase HIV Testing Frequency in Men Who Have Sex With Men (The iTest Study)
clinical_study.official_title: Comparisons of Public Health Screening Methods for Acute and Early HIV Infection: Home Self-Testing for HIV Infection

collaborator.agency: Public Health - Seattle and King County

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the availability of home self-testing for HIV will increase HIV testing frequency among men who have sex with men without negatively impacting their risk for HIV acquisition.

detailed_description.textblock:
HIV counseling and testing remains one of the most effective HIV prevention interventions because many individuals newly diagnosed with HIV infection will alter their behaviors to reduce the risk of HIV transmission to others. In the U.S., men who have sex with men (MSM) represent the group with the greatest risk for HIV acquisition despite a high penetrance of testing, in part because their frequent exposures and infrequent testing can result in long intervals between HIV acquisition and diagnosis. Efforts to prevent HIV transmission among MSM must therefore increase the frequency of HIV testing and thereby decrease the time interval that infected individuals are unaware of their status and their potential for transmission. Home self-testing for HIV may increase the frequency of HIV testing, but there are concerns that it may also have negative consequences, including decreased access to risk reduction counseling.
We will randomize 246 MSM at high risk of HIV acquisition either to have access to home self-testing for HIV using the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test or to standard, clinic-based HIV testing for 15 months to determine the effects of home self-testing availability on HIV testing frequency and markers of risk for HIV acquisition and to assess the acceptability and ease of use of home self-testing. After screening to determine eligibility, study visits will occur at baseline and at 15 months. Both visits will include HIV/STD screening and surveys regarding HIV testing and risk behaviors. During follow-up, participants will be asked to complete brief online surveys after testing for HIV.

primary_outcome.description: Number of HIV tests during follow-up reported by participants at end-of-study visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Condomless Anal Intercourse With HIV-positive or Unknown Status Partner in Last 3 Months
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From 6 to 9 months and 12 to 15 months of follow-up

secondary_outcome.description: Includes syphilis, gonorrhea, and chlamydial infection

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Male Condomless Anal Intercourse Partners in Last 3 Months

intervention.intervention_name: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test
intervention.description: Participants in this arm will be given access to home HIV self-testing kits with the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use with oral fluids. They will be trained to use this device to test themselves for HIV and be able to request up to one self-testing kit per month throughout follow-up.

intervention.intervention_name: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test
intervention.description: The device is the home HIV self-testing kit that includes the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use on oral fluids. The kit itself is not the focus of this trial. As described in the Behavioral Intervention section, the intervention is having access to home self-testing for HIV.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male
- Age ≥18
- Has sex with men
- HIV-negative
- Meets PHSKC HIV/STD Program definition of "high risk"
- Plans to live in Seattle for the next 15 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to safely and confidentially receive or store a home testing kit

facility.name: Public Health - Seattle & King County STD Clinic, located at Harborview Medical Center

responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, Division of Allergy & Infectious Diseases

group.title: Home Testing
group.description: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test: Participants in this arm will be given access to home HIV self-testing kits with the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use with oral fluids. They will be trained to use this device to test themselves for HIV and be able to request up to one self-testing kit per month throughout follow-up.

They will be trained to use this device to test themselves for HIV and be able to request up to one self-testing kit per month throughout follow-up.

outcome.title: HIV Testing Frequency
outcome.description: Number of HIV tests during follow-up reported by participants at end-of-study visit

group.title: Home Testing
group.description: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test: Participants in this arm will be given access to home HIV self-testing kits with the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use with oral fluids. measure.title: HIV Testing Frequency
measure.description: Number of HIV tests during follow-up reported by participants at end-of-study visit

outcome.title: Condomless Anal Intercourse With HIV-positive or Unknown Status Partner in Last 3 Months
outcome.time_frame: From 6 to 9 months and 12 to 15 months of follow-up
outcome.population: Included "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" as number who completed follow-up. However, only participants who responded to the question regarding non-concordant condomless anal intercourse in the last 3 months were included in this analysis for each time point.

group.title: Home Testing
group.description: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test: Participants in this arm will be given access to home HIV self-testing kits with the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use with oral fluids. They will be trained to use this device to test themselves for HIV and be able to request up to one self-testing kit per month throughout follow-up.

measure.title: Condomless Anal Intercourse With HIV-positive or Unknown Status Partner in Last 3 Months
measure.population: Included "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" as number who completed follow-up. However, only participants who responded to the question regarding non-concordant condomless anal intercourse in the last 3 months were included in this analysis for each time point.

class.title: Measured at end of study (15 months)

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Non-inferiority bound: Self-testing was to be considered non-inferior to standard testing if the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the odds ratio fell below 2.
analysis.estimate_desc: The home testing arm represents the numerator and the standard testing arm the denominator.

outcome.title: Bacterial Sexually Transmitted Infections
outcome.description: Includes syphilis, gonorrhea, and chlamydial infection
outcome.population: Includes only participants who received screening for sexually transmitted infections at the end-of-study visit.

group.title: Home Testing
group.description: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test: Participants in this arm will be given access to home HIV self-testing kits with the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use with oral fluids. They will be trained to use this device to test themselves for HIV and be able to request up to one self-testing kit per month throughout follow-up.

measure.title: Bacterial Sexually Transmitted Infections
measure.description: Includes syphilis, gonorrhea, and chlamydial infection
measure.population: Includes only participants who received screening for sexually transmitted infections at the end-of-study visit.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Home testing was to be considered non-inferior to standard testing with respect to STI prevalence if the upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the difference between the two arms (home - standard) fell below 10%.

outcome.title: Number of Male Condomless Anal Intercourse Partners in Last 3 Months
outcome.population: Included "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" as number who completed follow-up. However, only participants who responded to the question regarding condomless anal intercourse partners in the last 3 months were included in this analysis for each time point.

group.title: Home Testing
group.description: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test: Participants in this arm will be given access to home HIV self-testing kits with the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use with oral fluids. They will be trained to use this device to test themselves for HIV and be able to request up to one self-testing kit per month throughout follow-up.

measure.title: Number of Male Condomless Anal Intercourse Partners in Last 3 Months
measure.population: Included "Overall Number of Participants Analyzed" as number who completed follow-up. However, only participants who responded to the question regarding condomless anal intercourse partners in the last 3 months were included in this analysis for each time point.

class.title: Measured at end of study (15 months)

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Self-testing was to be considered non-inferior with respect to the number of reported male CAI partners if the upper bound of the 95% CI for the fold-difference in the number of partners between the two arms (self ÷ standard testing) fell below 2.
analysis.estimate_desc: The home testing arm represents the numerator and the standard testing arm the denominator.

group.title: Home Testing
group.description: Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test: Participants in this arm will be given access to home HIV self-testing kits with the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use with oral fluids. They will be trained to use this device to test themselves for HIV and be able to request up to one self-testing kit per month throughout follow-up. Home HIV self-testing with OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test: The device is the home HIV self-testing kit that includes the OraQuick ADVANCE® Rapid HIV-1/2 Antibody Test for use on oral fluids. The kit itself is not the focus of this trial. As described in the Behavioral Intervention section, the intervention is having access to home self-testing for HIV.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
